text: The 1971 UCI Track Cycling World Championships were the World Championship for track cycling. They took place in Varese, Italy in 1971.World Championship Track Cycling 2014-1893 Eleven events were contested, 9 for men (3 for professionals, 6 for amateurs) and 2 for women. ==Medal summary== {| |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Professional Events |- |Men's sprint | Leijn Loevesijn || Robert Van Lancker || Giordano Turrini |- | |Dirk Baert || Charly Grosskost || Hugh Porter |- |Men's motor-paced | Theo Verschueren || Jacob Oudkerk || Domenico de Lillo |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Men's Amateur Events |- | |Eduard Rapp || Peder Pedersen || Pierre Trentin |- |Men's sprint | Daniel Morelon ||Sergeï Kravtsov || Ivan Kucirek |- | | Martín Emilio Rodríguez || Josef Fuchs || Giacomo Bazzan |- |Men's team pursuit | Pietro Algeri Giacomo Bazzan Giorgio Morbiato Luciano Borgognoni || Thomas Huschke Heinz Richter Herbert Richter Uwe Unterwalder || Günter Haritz Udo Hempel Peter Vonhof Jürgen Colombo |- |Men's motor-paced |Horst Gnas || Rainer Podlesch || Gaby Minneboo |- |Men's tandem | Hans-Jürgen Geschke Werner Otto || Jürgen Barth Rainer Muller || Pierre Trentin Daniel Morelon |- bgcolor="#cccccc" | colspan=7 | Women's Events |- |Women's sprint |Galina Tsareva |Galina Ermolaeva |Iva Zajikova |- |Women's individual pursuit |Tamara Garkuchina |Keetie Hage |Beryl Burton |} ==Medal table== ==See also== * 1971 UCI Road World Championships ==References== Uci Track Cycling World Championships, 1971 Track cycling Category:UCI Track Cycling World Championships by year Category:International cycle races hosted by Italy
title: 1971 UCI Track Cycling World Championships
